a.title: Preschool Lessons during coronavirus
a.style: font-size: 14pt; font-weight: bold; white-space: pre-wrap; text-decoration-line: underline;

div.style: text-align: center; text-indent: 48px;
text-align: center; text-indent: 48px;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

div.span: Seniors, unfortunately because of this virus we will not be holding prom this year. Although it is disappointing, CEO Justin Jennings made the decision in the best interest of scholars' health

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Seniors there is some good news. Graduation is tentatively schedule for August 3. Pease keep in mind this could change due to the virus as well.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: center;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span:
Thank you and please stay home and stay safe. We'll get through this and we will be Youngstown Strong.
Technology Survey
YCSD wants to learn about the technology scholars have in their homes. Please complete our survey to help us as we plan for the future.
English version: https://forms.gle/7YLC4hsxg5B4jrdC6
en Espanol:
https://forms.gle/5KARkXEZYEe3LhBb7

span.style: font-size: 14pt; white-space: pre-wrap; text-indent: 36pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);

strong.span: YCSD Emergency Meal Service Program Change—Assistance From City

em.span: Food will be available at six sites starting on Monday, March 30 (pickup only)

p.span: and the United Way of Youngstown and the Mahoning Valley

are teaming up with YCSD to start a meal service pickup program on Monday, March 30. Meals will NOT be available this Thursday (March 26) as previously planned because of a necessary pause in service from our central kitchen. Some of our kitchen team have been placed in a 14-day quarantine since they might have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
"Currently, there is no evidence of food or food packaging being associated with the transmission of COVID-19," the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on its website (

Regular safety standards are in place whenever school meals are being prepared, and YCSD food service workers wear protective gloves and masks when they prepare food. YCSD CEO Justin M. Jennings said, "We are concerned for the health and safety of our workers and encourage an abundance of caution in light of possible infection of the COVID-19 virus. We've notified those who were potentially exposed and asked that they quarantine themselves for 14 days. We don't believe any students or volunteers were exposed but encourage anyone who is feeling ill to quarantine themselves and to follow guidelines available at
and from local health care providers."

The central kitchen area is cleaned and sanitized daily and will be ready to collect and pack food again soon. We have identified employees to take over some of the central kitchen duties. Anyone working in the foodservice area will wear gloves, masks and maintain a safe distance from each other.

Families should be aware that some foods do contain allergens such as peanut butter. If a scholar receives special diet meals from YCSD, per doctor’s order, call 330-744-7194 and arrange pick up of special meals.

Our central kitchen will work to pack as many lunches as possible to meet the need to provide 15,000 meals. The Ohio Department of Health is also sending helpers to pack some of the food up into boxes to free up racks to reach the 15,000 meals we need to distribute for a week. Breakfasts are prepackaged and will be ready to serve.
The city is setting up tents and tables at the following sites in front of:

The modified meal service will be pick up only, and the pickup time is 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at all sites. We have firefighters, police officers, city officials, and volunteers who will help pack and serve six sites at the curbside to cars or people who have walked to the location. No one will enter the buildings. Specialty food trucks will deliver to the six locations, and the food will be distributed until all meals are gone.

We have found that our school buses are not well equipped to handle the transportation of food. It is also safer in terms of risking exposure to the virus to provide the curbside pick up. We understand that it might be more challenging to get to the food pick up sites, but this is the safest option.

p.style: margin: 0in -13.5pt 0.0001pt 0in; line-height: 22px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); letter-spacing: normal; text-align: center;

a.title: 3/30/20 Food Pick up Spanish

strong.style: text-align: center; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-size: large; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);
letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; font-size: large; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);

div.h2: Welcome to the Youngstown City School District

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.br:
First, I want to congratulate the Chaney High School Cowboys Boys Basketball team and their coaches for their Division II District Championship! It's the team's first district championship since 2001. The Cowboys will travel Thursday to the Canton Memorial Civic Center to play Akron St. Vincent-St. Mary in the regional semi-finals. Good luck, Cowboys!!
I'm sure you've all heard about the coronavirus that's affecting people across the nation and the world. At YCSD, we're following the precautions and procedures outlined by public health officials, but at this point, there's no cause for alarm. The virus has caused some severe symptoms in the elderly, those with underlying health problems and people with compromised immune symptoms. For most people though, it's been pretty mild -- at least to this point.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: It's important that everyone follows the steps urged by state and local health departments to make sure we all stay safe. Most of it really is common sense:

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: * Wash your hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. When soap and water aren't available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: * Avoid touching your face with hands that haven't been washed.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: * Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: * Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue and then throw the tissue away.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: * Clean and disinfect objects and surfaces that are touched frequently.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: Another issue that's gotten a lot of attention recently is the possible expansion of the state voucher program that allows scholars to attend private schools with public money. As legislators at the statehouse argue about details and how/if the program will be expanded, we at YCSD have taken a firm position against it.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: The voucher program takes money away from public schools and public school scholars like ours and sends it to private schools where taxpayers have no say in how it's spent. The expansion initially approved in Columbus would gut many public school districts in our area.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: I've finished my rounds of meetings with YCSD staff as well as conducted a community meeting regarding what people want the district to look like in the future and I plan to release my strategic plan later this month or in early April. I heard from a lot of you and I appreciate your participation.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: The document will provide a framework for the school district beginning next school year and through the next several years.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
